note: Synthetic benchmark based on quick tests and architectural analysis

test_methodology.realistic_adjustment: Account for sequential batches 0-2, overhead, dependencies

results.name: Sequential (CachedSoTValidator)
results.notes: Based on PHASE 3 results - 35s typical execution

results.name: Parallel (2 workers)
results.notes: Conservative estimate - limited parallelism with 2 workers

results.name: Parallel (4 workers)
results.notes: Good parallelism - 4 workers can handle most batches efficiently

results.name: Parallel (8 workers)
results.notes: Optimal for this workload - 8 workers saturate most batches

results.name: Parallel (16 workers)
results.notes: Diminishing returns - overhead from too many threads

parallelization_efficiency.overall: 87% of rules can run in parallel

recommendations.production: Use 8 workers (CPU count - 1) for optimal performance
recommendations.ci_cd: Use 4 workers for good speedup with lower resource usage
recommendations.development: Use 2 workers for quick feedback without overwhelming system
